channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: USPTO resources for inventors, innovators, and entrepreneurs
item.description: Are you new to the world of patents and trademarks and need some help? The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO provides a wealth of resources that can help you learn more about how to protect your intellectual property (IP).

item.title: National Medal of Technology and Innovation webinar 2022
item.description: The National Medal of Technology and Innovation (NMTI) is America's highest honor for technological achievement and innovation. The president of the United States presents the NMTI at a special White House ceremony.

item.title: Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
item.description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and the Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. You can watch the virtual public session at the following WebEx link. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO.

item.title: Patent basics
item.description: Are you interested in learning about intellectual property (IP) basics? Join us for a free, virtual session as we explore the different types of patents, including utility, design, and plant. In this session, experts from the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) will show you the difference between provisional patent applications and non-provisional patent applications and how to use them.

item.title: Women’s Entrepreneurship Symposium, part two: Trends and opportunities
Trademark basics
item.description: Are you an entrepreneur or a small business owner? Do you have a name or logo you're using to advertise your business? Join the experts at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for an informative session where we will explore the different types of trademarks, including words, slogans, designs, logos, and trade dress.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
Learn how to protect your technology abroad
item.description: Did you know that you can seek patent protection in another country? If you want to learn more about filing foreign patent applications, join us for this free session given by patent experts from the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO).

item.title: Women’s Entrepreneurship Symposium, part three: From inspiration to commercialization
K-12 IP education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: What you need to sell your arts and crafts online: An e-commerce primer for Native American visual artists and craftspeople
item.description: Native American, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian visual artists and craftspeople face unique challenges with the shift to online sales and continued limits on attendance at local arts and crafts fairs. Register now for this free webinar to learn how to develop and expand your e-commerce presence.
